summary: About 10% of Americans per year cared for an elderly parent or spouse from 2011 through 2017. These family caregivers may risk their long-term financial security if they have to work less or pay for caregiving expenses such as travel or medicine. More than half of people who cared for parents or spouses said they went to work late, left early, or took time off...
title: Retirement Security: Some Parental and Spousal Caregivers Face Financial Risks
